prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. - Face 1: Create two loops, loop_1 and loop_2, separated by a gap equal to the sketch scale parameter. Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.045, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.045, 0.0] to [0.045, 0.045] - Line 3: [0.045, 0.045] to [0.0, 0.045] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.045] to [0.0, 0.0] Loop 2: - Line 1: [0.0075, 0.0075] to [0.0375, 0.0075] - Line 2: [0.0375, 0.0075] to [0.0375, 0.0375] - Line 3: [0.0375, 0.0375] to [0.0075, 0.0375] - Line 4: [0.0075, 0.0375] to [0.0075, 0.0075] Three of the four lines in each loop are shared, forming a square within each loop. The sketch has a uniform scale factor of 0.045 applied to it, making the overall dimensions of this part as follows: - Length: 0.045 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.045 Using the above 2D sketch, create a 3D model by extruding the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance equal to the coordinate system's translation vector (0.75) plus the sketch scale parameter (0.045), resulting in a height equal to the width of the part (0.75). Perform a boolean operation to combine this part with any previously created objects in the CAD model by adding (joining) materials.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.0],"End Point":[0.045,0.045]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.045]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.045],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0075,0.0075],"End Point":[0.0375,0.0075]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.0075],"End Point":[0.0375,0.0375]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.0375],"End Point":[0.0075,0.0375]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0075,0.0375],"End Point":[0.0075,0.0075]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.045,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.4915, 0.0]. Next, create a face for the 2D sketch. On this face, create a loop. The loop is made up of four lines. The first line starts at [0.0, 0.0] and goes to [0.75, 0.0]. The second line starts at [0.75, 0.0] and goes to [0.75, 0.3946]. The third line starts at [0.75, 0.3946] and goes to [0.0, 0.3946]. The fourth line starts at [0.0, 0.3946] and goes back to [0.0, 0.0]. After creating the loop, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.4915 units and there is no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the top and bottom faces are smaller than those of the first part. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector is [0.1399, 0.0, 0.1361]. Next, create a face for the 2D sketch. On this face, create a loop. The loop is made up of three lines. The first line starts at [0.0, 0.2585] and goes to [0.6101, 0.0]. The second line starts at [0.6101, 0.0] and goes to [0.6101, 0.2585]. The third line starts at [0.6101, 0.2585] and goes back to [0.0, 0.2585]. After creating the loop, do not scale the sketch. Then, transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. There is no depth towards the normal and the depth in the opposite direction of the normal is 0.4915 units. The sketch is scaled by a factor of 0.6101. Note: This part will cut into the first part, removing material and creating a new solid body.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.4915,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.3946]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.3946],"End Point":[0.0,0.3946]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3946],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.4915,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.1399,0.0,0.1361]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2585],"End Point":[0.6101,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6101,0.0],"End Point":[0.6101,0.2585]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6101,0.2585],"End Point":[0.0,0.2585]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.4915,"sketch_scale":0.6101,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Construct the base part of the final shape as a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.2143, 0.0) 2. Generate the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system with the following information: * Sketch a polygon from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.3214) to (0.5357, 0.561) to (0.2143, 0.561) to (0.2143, 0.3467) to (0.0, 0.3467) to (0.0, 0.0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2143 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: New body feature, which results in the creation of a new solid body. The base part is now constructed, and it has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.2143 - Height: 0.75 Continue with the next part following the same pattern as the first part. If necessary, intersect, join, or cut materials based on the final shape requirements, but avoid using specific boolean operation terms such as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation', 'CutFeatureOperation' etc. Use their natural language descriptions instead. Always provide detailed step-by-step instructions stating the shape being constructed. Use clear headings, section breaks, and `<part_num>` tags to distinguish between parts, sketches, curves, loops, or faces. If a loop has many curves, mention how many curves are there. Keep the instructions concise and imperative.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.2143,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.3214]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.3214],"End Point":[0.5357,0.561]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5357,0.561],"End Point":[0.2143,0.561]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2143,0.561],"End Point":[0.2143,0.3467]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.2143,0.3467],"End Point":[0.0,0.3467]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3467],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2143,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Ring Step 1: Create a new coordinate system * Euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation vector: [-0.0003, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane * Create two concentric circles with the following properties: + Circle 1: - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.375 + Circle 2: - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.325 Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch * Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter: 0.75 Step 4: Transform and extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch * No rotation: euler\\_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Extrude the sketch with the following properties: + Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.075 + Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 + Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole Step 1: Create a new coordinate system * Euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation vector: [0.0497, 0.05, 0.0] Step 2: Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane * Create a circle with the following properties: + Center: [0.325, 0.325] + Radius: 0.325 Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch * Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter: 0.65 Step 4: Transform and extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch * No rotation: euler\\_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Extrude the sketch with the following properties: + Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.05 + Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 + Operation: Join with the previous solid body</description>

<description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and Flat Bottom** **Sketch on Face 1** 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) from the coordinate system origin (0,0) to the point (0.195, 0). 2. Draw an arc (arc\\_1) starting from the endpoint of line\\_1, with a midpoint at (0.21, 0.015) and ending at (0.195, 0.03). 3. Draw a line (line\\_2) from the endpoint of arc\\_1, to the point (0.0447, 0.0551). 4. Draw an arc (arc\\_2) starting from the endpoint of line\\_2, with a midpoint at (0.0338, 0.0594) and ending at (0.0255, 0.0677). 5. Draw a line (line\\_3) from the endpoint of arc\\_2, to the point (0.0255, 0.3749). 6. Draw an arc (arc\\_3) starting from the endpoint of line\\_3, with a midpoint at (0.0282, 0.3871) and ending at (0.0359, 0.3969). 7. Draw a line (line\\_4) from the endpoint of arc\\_3, to the point (0.1616, 0.4205). 8. Draw an arc (arc\\_4) starting from the endpoint of line\\_4, with a midpoint at (0.1441, 0.4325) and ending at (0.156, 0.45). 9. Draw a line (line\\_5) from the endpoint of arc\\_4, to the coordinate system origin (0, 0.45). 10. Draw a line (line\\_6) from the coordinate system origin (0,0.45) to the coordinate system origin (0, 0). **Extrusion** 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45 (sketch\\_scale). 2. Extrude the 2D sketch towards the positive normal direction by 0.1875 and towards the negative normal direction by 0.1875 for the 3D model. 3. Perform a 'New Body Connection' Boolean operation to combine this CAD part with the previous parts. **Part Dimensions** 1. The length of the part is 0.45. 2. The width of the part is 0.375. 3. The height of the part is 0.45.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.375,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.195,0.0]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.195,0.0],"Mid Point":[0.21,0.015],"End Point":[0.195,0.03]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.195,0.03],"End Point":[0.0447,0.0551]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.0447,0.0551],"Mid Point":[0.0338,0.0594],"End Point":[0.0255,0.0677]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0255,0.0677],"End Point":[0.0255,0.3749]},"arc_3":{"Start Point":[0.0255,0.3749],"Mid Point":[0.0282,0.3871],"End Point":[0.0359,0.3969]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0359,0.3969],"End Point":[0.1616,0.4205]},"arc_4":{"Start Point":[0.1616,0.4205],"Mid Point":[0.1441,0.4325],"End Point":[0.156,0.45]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.156,0.45],"End Point":[0.0,0.45]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.45],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1875,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.1875,"sketch_scale":0.45,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
